question.title: What is the first step in the diagnostic tree for haematuria?

option_a.title: Blood test to check for urinary tract infections
option_a.description: A blood test may be performed to check for urinary tract infections, but it is not the first step

option_b.title: Urinalysis to check for blood and protein
option_b.description: Urinalysis is the first step in the diagnostic tree for haematuria

option_c.title: Imaging studies to check for kidney stones
option_c.description: Imaging studies may be performed later in the diagnostic process, but not as the first step

option_d.title: Urinary catheterization to check for blockages
option_d.description: Urinary catheterization is not typically performed as the first step in the diagnostic process
